other_tests.findings: A 500-ml sample of cloudy fluid was aspirated from the cystic mass. Analysis of the fluid sample revealed an amylase level of 5000 U per liter and a lipase level higher than 1 million U per liter, with abundant neutrophils but no organisms.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The catheter drained 200 to 300 ml of clear fluid daily, and the infant was discharged from the hospital on day 13 with the catheter still in place. At home, she remained well; she was afebrile, active, and feeding well.

other_tests.findings: CT revealed a fluid collection (measuring 2 cm by 3 cm) near the pancreatic body. Contrast material was seen in the distal duodenum and proximal jejunum, findings consistent with pancreatic communication.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up ultrasonography performed 2 weeks later revealed persistence of the fluid collection near the pancreas, but the patient was doing well, with no fever and a normal abdominal examination. Follow-up ultrasonography performed 3 months after the operation revealed no residual fluid collection, and the patient continued to do well, with no fever or abdominal pain.

other_tests.findings: Cultures of the fluid sample were negative.
